bibl.title: Ray Raymond v. Territory of Washington. Gillespie Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territoru of Washington County of Spokane}ss.
Territory of Washington vs Ray Raymond

W. D. Gillespie sworn I hold the office of Policeman in Spokane Falls I know the Defendant Ray Raymond and where she lives, have been a Policeman two months and a half I was at her residence on the Morning of the 26th of June and saw the dead body of a man and heard a a pistol prior to that.

On the morning of the shooting I was at the California house and heard the shot Have found the First shot Bark I see the door of the slut house open and looked to me like a man laying in the hallway and some one being over him I ran down to the slut house found a man lying there in the door I asked what the trouble was, of the defendant she stated she had shot at the man and said she didn't shoot him I went to work to see if he was there pulled down his shirt in front and told her she had shot him sh said O My God have I shot him; at the time I got there she
was asking some one to bring water

After I told her that the man was shot she told me that they were in the middle parlor taking a drink and that one of the Girls got up and went to the door and say who is in the hall of said door and looking and in the hall says O Ray there is a man in the hall and Ray got up and went out into the hall and asked the man what he was doing there and ordered him to leave, he said he would not, and struck at her and tried to close the door she stepped into her room and took a pistol out of the drawer came back and asked the man if he would go now said he would not and struck at her, and she pulled up the gun and fired,

Witness requested to make a diagram of the Hall + rooms in the building where the homicide and gave a verbal discription of the premises The man was laying in the North hall with his head lying near the out door part of his body in the in the entrance way one leg - the hall inside the inner door the door on the right is where she says the weak light was burning in the Hall
As a general thing you could see one through the slut The slut was skinny

I did not pay particular attention when the man was shot but as near as I can recall of right side of the neck near the coller bone the man was alive after I got there but did not seem concerning I was in the middle parlor of the house at the time of his death
I arrested the defendant and took the pistol from her witness exhibit pistol three loaded chambers now and two empty 4 shells is one shell empty the pistol now is in stact mailierin which I recind it

The man had large features large nose about 38 years old possible 40 he had a a dark checkered coat no rest a can wool or collar shirt blue Overalls Boots wone for wear - left Boot hole = top where big toe would come his nose prick marks at large Color of hair Brown
Cross Ex

Had a very long moustache between sandy & dark gray tanery drooping no hat on, coat on. as stated before dark checkered gray collar or the shirt lucid = front blue overalls one leg rolled up whith left leg shoulder not say if any are donee anything with the chlothes or not overalls seemed soiled
Had no beard other than moustache

A man should Judge would weigh 150 to 155 medium height a man about as tall as Judge Peel little taller larger man then the Hart Lad a very large nose and prick marked His coat was new did not notice any dirt on it
I was in the Bar room the California I House still doing close to the side door a the west when I heard the shot

Then I ran downhill across the street and was with 20 feet when I saw the light in the slut building I spoke to some one in the California house as I ran out when I saw the light in the slut building and not see any one coming seem to me I did see some one on the street but do not know who it was saw no one ahead of seen some one behind me Door was entirely ajar when I saw the light in the slut building the door of the body man was entirely ajar the Mans Body would prevent it from doing
When I first saw the door ajar saw the same person was leaning over him as when I arrived at

at the door It was the defendant something less than a minute spared after I heard the shot until I got there The deft was asking some one to bring watter or why the did not bring water She seemedin the act of trying to give relief to the man she was excited and was laughing her head and asked me of he was hurt and said she had shot at him but did not think she had hurt him

She adressed me first and asked him of towards a couple of minutes afterwords when I told hershe had shot him she told me she did not instead to shoot him she was trying get some one to give him some whiskey so as to revive him Shortly after I got there I think one of the Girls from the House brought some water the first thing after I got there I asked her what was the trouble and she replied that she shot at him or the man I seen not shot what the she said him or the man - His head laying the only N. E. corner, on his back with his face up his ehad pressed forward the wall one of his legs one way & one angled up - Bunam Set
She said after stated her she had shot the man O. My God have I shot him She showed considerable feeling

threw up her hands and began crying going from one room to the other - all she had to do was to go from one room the hall to the other adjourning room to get whiskey I followed near all the time she did not by to get any she was very much excided and saying did not make any effort to except was about 2 10 4 minutes - before I got to do the Revolver The First thing I and been to do look to see if the man was hurt when I got up from the man I asked for the Revolver She was standing just on the inside of the door in the middle Parlor I asked her for the Revolver she says here it is and took it from somewhere in her dress

I was on the left side of the body when I got up to get the Revolver- she could see me in an a the body of the man This occupied only a few minutes She told me this a few minutes after, she told me she asked him to get out he replied he would not go out, did not at that or any other time before the coroner tell me that he said he be dead if he would go out
I did not swear before the coroner Jury that she told me that she had told him to go out and he said he be dead if he would go out I am trying

to give her exact words and there if I told him to go out were all their words I referred it was the outside door that was referred to that she was inside the door She has said he struck at her from what I understood he only struck at her and before she got the revolver, she said she got the revolver from a drawer in her Burnam in her hand she said she came back and ordered him out again he then struck at her and she then raised the revolver and fired did not say he struck her on the right shoulder did not swear so before coroner jury

No one arrested at the scene with me until one Came in about a minute- I think her Lynch helped me to open his shirt and examine the wound and was inside the vest in le with- me Lynch a small man with dark moustache I meant to keep people out I did not close the outer door, after the door was closed I tried to keep People out say 50 less minutes- When I got there I saw no one but Ray in the Hall saw one of the Girls think it was Ruby Stanley in the middle parlor door.

had seen the man that was killed before about Mr Burnes place at the door going in or in about Lelf over before Burnes place is a saloon at that time I was going into B coming out of Banres he was going in I noticed he was a stranger in the place paid no particular attention to him
He was not drinking when I saw him but had the appearance of having been drinking acted as though he had a little aboard

I saw him on the street just before dark was in a crowd same three or did not know them, know Johnny May be 188 by sight do not know whether he had been with the man before he was murdered heard he was I subpoenaed him to appear at this examination on the part of the Territory the same
I have told all as far as I remember about the case
ReDirect

The mans coat was new the front clean did not see the back should Judge the overalls & shirt had been worn same time and were soiled I was the first man that mached the house after I heard the shot I saw at the house Defedant and
Ruby Stanley and herself said in the middle parlor
Defendant mentioned the Girl there were two Gentlemen drinking together Pub hall about 4 feet Deft

Body extended nearly to the outer door for towards door body nearly in hall When I first got there she was swinging her hands over him after I told her the man was shot she may felt considerable feeling Her demeanor was after the manner of one very much excited She related circumstances four times I stated an first examination twice vaired such time added to each time she told is I believe that the last couple of times she told it she was more case about did not any cannot retell what new facts she told except it was little different than before Hall was lighted when I looked down after the shot Believe the south hall is the customary entrance but they use both
ReCross

I know the character of the House House is a house of public character one that gentlemen frequent at all times of the night Suppose they ask for permission to enter if door is closed they cannot enter without asking when I go I ring the bell each time she told a little more that is added a little more to the story she surround that night, third & fourth malt after serving after I got there saw
Ruby Stanley & Ray only I told her where the man was dead these accounts were told by her before I told her man was dead
ReDirect

She was sooning about three minutes she threw up her hands gan way and did not seem to have conciousness when she came to she came to she went from room to room She swooned after stated her must arrest her same 5 minutes she swooned on the Road to Mr Gilespies and
ReCross
I dont know Dont know the immediate cause of swooning, and was given her to from a room by putting water in her face
ReDirect
Saw the body of the man after he was dead and know he was dead Transactions I have described took place - Spokane Falls, Spokane CountyWash TY
I and a say to man when I saw him before this occurance was under the influence of liquor seemed to be very quiet and peacable
Think there is a Bell on the door at the North Hall
ReCross
No one called my attention to the man in the afternoon W. D. Gillespie
Subscribed and sworn to before me on this June 29th 1886 J.J.L. Peel Justice of the Peace
